mainBoard.name: Disciple of Grace
mainBoard.originalText:
Protection from black
Cycling o2 (You may pay o2 and discard this card from your hand to draw a card. Play this ability as an instant.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

mainBoard.text:

mainBoard.flavorText:
The ceiling and the floor fell in love, but only the wall knew.
—Dal saying

foreignData.name: Mauer der Lebenskraft
foreignData.text: Du erhältst für jeden Kampfschadenspunkt, der der Mauer der Lebenskraft zugefügt wird, 1 Lebenspunkt dazu.

mainBoard.name: Wall of Essence
mainBoard.originalText:
(Walls cannot attack.)
For each 1 combat damage dealt to Wall of Essence, gain 1 life.

rulings.text: Wall of Essence’s triggered ability will trigger even if it’s dealt lethal damage. For example, if it’s dealt 7 combat damage, its ability will trigger and you’ll gain 7 life.

mainBoard.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Whenever Wall of Essence is dealt combat damage, you gain that much life.

mainBoard.flavorText: Urza saw the wall and realized that even if he tore every Phyrexian to pieces, they would still resist him.

foreignData.name: Schrottmauer
foreignData.text:
Die Schrottmauer zählt als Mauer.
Immer wenn die Schrottmauer blockt, bringe sie am Ende des Kampfes auf die Hand ihres Besitzers zurück.

mainBoard.name: Wall of Junk
mainBoard.originalText: Whenever Wall of Junk blocks, return it to owner's hand at end of combat.

rulings.text: It only returns to owner's hand if it is still on the battlefield at end of combat.

mainBoard.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
When Wall of Junk blocks, return it to its owner's hand at end of combat. (Return it only if it's on the battlefield.)

mainBoard.flavorText: "Our belief shall be the lance that pierces Volrath's heart."

mainBoard.name: Paladin en-Vec
mainBoard.originalText: First strike, protection from black, protection from red
mainBoard.text: First strike, protection from black and from red (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike. It can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything black or red.)

foreignData.name: Wächter des Heiligtums
foreignData.text: Opfere den Wächter des Heiligtums: Verhindere allen Schaden, der einer Kreatur oder einem Spieler aus einer Quelle zugefügt wird. (Weiterer Schaden aus dieser Quelle wird normal behandelt.)

mainBoard.name: Sanctum Guardian
mainBoard.originalText: Sacrifice Sanctum Guardian: Prevent all damage to a creature or player from one source. (Treat further damage from that source normally.)
mainBoard.text: Sacrifice Sanctum Guardian: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to any target this turn, prevent that damage.

mainBoard.flavorText: The less you have, the harder you fight for it.

foreignData.name: Netzmauer

Entferne am Ende des Kampfes alle Kreaturen, die von der Netzmauer geblockt wurden, ganz aus dem Spiel.
Bringe alle Kreaturen, die von der Netzmauer aus dem Spiel entfernt wurden, unter der Kontrolle ihres Besitzers wieder ins Spiel, wenn die Netzmauer das Spiel verlässt.

mainBoard.name: Wall of Nets
mainBoard.originalText:
(Walls cannot attack.)
At end of combat, remove from the game all creatures blocked by Wall of Nets.
If Wall of Nets leaves play, return to play under their owners' control all creatures removed from the game with Wall of Nets.

rulings.text: It only exiles creatures if this card is still on the battlefield at the end of combat.

mainBoard.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
At end of combat, exile all creatures blocked by Wall of Nets.
When Wall of Nets leaves the battlefield, return all cards exiled with Wall of Nets to the battlefield under their owners' control.

"Strapping on nine hundred pounds of armor every morning would make any warrior cross."
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

foreignData.name: Marmortitan

mainBoard.name: Marble Titan
mainBoard.originalText: Creatures with power 3 or greater do not untap during their controllers' untap phases.
mainBoard.text: Creatures with power 3 or greater don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.

mainBoard.flavorText:

—*Song of All*, canto 167

foreignData.name: Dunkler Sog
foreignData.text: X: Der Dunkle Sog fügt einer Kreatur oder einem Spieler Deiner Wahl X Schadenspunkte zu. Du kannst nur schwarzes Mana auf diese Art ausgeben. Du erhältst 1 Lebenspunkt für jeden Schadenspunkt, der auf diese Art zugefügt wird. Du kannst nicht mehr Lebenspunkte, als die Widerstandskraft der Kreatur beträgt oder als die Anzahl der Lebenspunkte des Spielers, dem mit dem Dunklen Sog Schaden zugefügt wurde, erhalten.

mainBoard.name: Drain Life
mainBoard.originalText:
oo
X Drain Life deals X damage to target creature or player. Spend only black mana in this way. Gain 1 life for each 1 damage dealt, but not more than the toughness of the creature or the life total of the player Drain Life damages.

rulings.text: Cost reducers can be used to reduce the X part of the mana cost.
You may gain up to the total toughness of the creature even if it was already damaged.

mainBoard.text:
Spend only black mana on X.
Drain Life deals X damage to any target. You gain life equal to the damage dealt, but not more life than the player's life total before the damage was dealt, the planeswalker's loyalty before the damage was dealt, or the creature's toughness.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"It is not your place to rule, Radiant. It may not even be mine."
—Serra

foreignData.name: Bescheidenheit
foreignData.text: Eine Kreatur Deiner Wahl verliert alle ihre Fähigkeiten und wird zu einer 0/1 Kreatur bis zum Ende des Zuges.

mainBoard.name: Humble
mainBoard.originalText: Target creature loses all abilities and is a 0/1 creature until end of turn.

rulings.text: Effects that modify a creature’s power and/or toughness, such as the effect of Seal of Strength, will apply to the creature no matter when they started to take effect. The same is true for any counters that change its power and/or toughness and effects that switch its power and toughness.

Humble doesn’t counter abilities that have already triggered or been activated. In particular, casting this spell won’t stop a creature’s ability that says “At the beginning of your upkeep,” “When this creature enters the battlefield,” or similar from triggering.

Humble overwrites all previous effects that set the creature’s base power and toughness to specific values. Any power- or toughness-setting effects that start to apply after Humble resolves will overwrite this effect.
If the affected creature gains an ability after Humble resolves, it will keep that ability.

mainBoard.text: Until end of turn, target creature loses all abilities and has base power and toughness 0/1.

foreignData.name: Beseitigung
foreignData.text:
Zerstöre eine nicht-schwarze Nicht-Artefaktkreatur Deiner Wahl. Diese Kreatur kann in diesem Zug nicht regenerieren.

mainBoard.originalText:

foreignData.name: Opal-Akrolith
foreignData.text:
Wenn einer Deiner Gegner erfolgreich einen Kreaturenzauber spricht und der Opal-Akrolith eine Verzauberung ist, wird der Opal-Akrolith zu einer 2/4 Kreatur, die als Wächter zählt.
0: Der Opal-Akrolith wird zu einer Verzauberung.

mainBoard.name: Opal Acrolith
mainBoard.originalText:
Whenever one of your opponents successfully casts a creature spell, if Opal Acrolith is an enchantment, Opal Acrolith becomes a 2/4 creature that counts as a Guardian.
o0: Opal Acrolith becomes an enchantment.

rulings.text: Changes into a creature even if the spell is countered.
It triggers when the spell is cast, which means it becomes a creature before that spell resolves.
When it turns into a creature, it is no longer an enchantment.
When it turns into an enchantment, it is no longer a creature.
A “creature spell” is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn’t matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

mainBoard.text:
Whenever an opponent casts a creature spell, if Opal Acrolith is an enchantment, Opal Acrolith becomes a 2/4 Soldier creature.
{0}: Opal Acrolith becomes an enchantment.

mainBoard.flavorText: "It is *not* sad," Radiant chided the lesser angel. "It is right. Every society must have its outcasts."

foreignData.name: Pariah
foreignData.text: Leite alle Schadenspunkte, die Dir zugefügt werden, auf die verzauberte Kreatur um.

mainBoard.name: Pariah
mainBoard.originalText: Redirect to enchanted creature all damage dealt to you.

rulings.text: If you control multiple Pariahs enchanting different creatures, you choose which redirection effect to apply. You can't divide damage dealt by one source or combat damage dealt by multiple creatures simultaneously. For example, if a spell would deal 6 damage to you and you control multiple Pariahs, you may have that 6 damage dealt to either of the enchanted creatures instead, but you can't choose to have 3 damage dealt to each one.
If you would be dealt combat damage, the damage dealt to the enchanted creature instead is still combat damage.

mainBoard.text:
Enchant creature
All damage that would be dealt to you is dealt to enchanted creature instead.

foreignData.name: Der Schwarze Tod
foreignData.text:
Opfer den Schwarzen Tod, wenn am Ende eines Zuges keine Kreaturen im Spiel sind.
{B}:Der Schwarze Tod fügt jeder Kreatur und jedem Spieler 1 Schadenspunkt zu.

mainBoard.name: Pestilence
mainBoard.originalText:
At the end of each turn, if no creatures are in play, sacrifice Pestilence.
oo
B Pestilence deals 1 damage to each creature and player.

rulings.text: Each activation is considered a new damage effect. An activation can only be 1 point of damage.

It will stay on the battlefield if there is a creature that is put into the graveyard during the end step. This is because this ability will not trigger at all if there is at least one creature on the battlefield as the end step begins.
Note that “until end of turn” effects wear off after “at the beginning of the end step” triggered abilities, so an artifact that animates until end of turn can keep this on the battlefield.

mainBoard.text:
At the beginning of the end step, if no creatures are on the battlefield, sacrifice Pestilence.
{B}: Pestilence deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

foreignData.name: Spiegel der Seele
foreignData.text:
Wenn während Deiner Versorgungsphase keine Spiegelungs-Spielsteine im Spiel sind, bringe einen Spiegelungs-Spielstein ins Spiel. Behandle diesen Spielstein wie eine 2/2 weiße Kreatur.
0: Zerstöre eine Spiegelung Deiner Wahl.

mainBoard.name: Spirit Mirror
mainBoard.originalText:
During your upkeep, if there are no Reflection tokens in play, put a Reflection token into play. Treat this token as a 2/2 white creature.
o0: Destroy target Reflection.

rulings.text: It checks if there are any Reflection tokens on the battlefield at the beginning of upkeep, and if there are it will not trigger at all. It will check again on resolution and will do nothing if a Reflection is on the battlefield at that time.

mainBoard.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, if there are no Reflection tokens on the battlefield, create a 2/2 white Reflection creature token.
{0}: Destroy target Reflection.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"Believe in the ideal, not the idol."
—Serra

foreignData.name: Anbetung
foreignData.text: Jeglicher Schaden, der eigentlich Deine Lebenspunkte unter 1 reduzieren würde, reduziert sie stattdessen auf 1, falls Du eine Kreatur kontrollierst.

mainBoard.name: Worship
mainBoard.originalText: Damage that would reduce your life total to less than 1 instead reduces it to 1 if you control a creature.

rulings.text: It reduces your life total to 1, not the damage to 1.

Worship does not prevent damage. It causes some damage to be unable to lower your life total. So any damage rendered useless by Worship was still dealt and is counted by effects that track the amount of damage done to a player. In addition, Worship does not prevent loss of life, so loss of life bypasses Worship.

mainBoard.text: If you control a creature, damage that would reduce your life total to less than 1 reduces it to 1 instead.

foreignData.name: Widerspiegelnder Teich
foreignData.text: {T}: Erhöhe Deinen Manavorrat um ein Mana eines Typs, welches ein Land, das Du kontrollierst, produzieren kann.

mainBoard.name: Reflecting Pool
mainBoard.originalText:
oc
T: Add to your mana pool one mana of any type that any land you control can produce.

rulings.text: Any change to a land's type or splicing of text into a land can affect the types of mana a land can produce.
Any replacement effects are considered by Reflecting Pool when determining the types of mana a land can produce.

Multiple Reflecting Pools won't help each other produce mana. If you control a Reflecting Pool, and all other lands you control either lack mana abilities or are other Reflecting Pools, you may still activate Reflecting Pool's ability — it just won't produce any mana.

Reflecting Pool checks the effects of all mana-producing abilities of lands you control, but it doesn't check their costs. For example, Vivid Crag says "{T}, Remove a charge counter from Vivid Crag: Add one mana of any color." If you control Vivid Crag and Reflecting Pool, you can tap Reflecting Pool for any color of mana. It doesn't matter whether Vivid Crag has a charge counter on it, and it doesn't matter whether it's untapped.
Reflecting Pool doesn't care about any restrictions or riders your lands put on the mana they produce, such as Pillar of the Paruns and Hall of the Bandit Lord do. It just cares about types of mana.
The types of mana are white, blue, black, red, green, and colorless.

mainBoard.text: {T}: Add one mana of any type that a land you control could produce.

sideBoard.name: Circle of Protection: Red
sideBoard.originalText: o1: Prevent all damage to you from a red source. (Treat further damage from that source normally.)

rulings.text: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn’t need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

sideBoard.text: {1}: The next time a red source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

sideBoard.flavorText:
"Let Phyrexia breed evil in the darkness; my holy light will reveal its taint."
—Serra

sideBoard.name: Yawgmoth's Edict
